item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} average queue size
item_prototype.description: The average queue length of the requests that were issued to the device.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} average requests size
item_prototype.description: The average size (in sectors) of the requests that were issued to the device.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} await
item_prototype.description: The average time (in milliseconds) for I/O requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} read operations per second
item_prototype.description: The number of read requests per second

item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} read from device per second
item_prototype.description: The number of kbytes read from the device per second

item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} read requests merge per second
item_prototype.description: The number of read requests merged per second that were queued to the hard disk

item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} read await
item_prototype.description: The average time (in milliseconds) for read requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} utilization
item_prototype.description: Percentage of CPU time during which I/O requests were issued to the device (bandwidth utilization for the device). Device saturation occurs when this value is close to 100%.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} write operations per second
item_prototype.description: The number (after merges) of write requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} written to the device per second
item_prototype.description: The number of kilobytes written to the device per second.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} write requests merge per second
item_prototype.description: The number of write requests merged per second that were queued to the device.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#HARDDISK} write await
item_prototype.description: The average time (in milliseconds) for write requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.

item.name: Maximum number of opened files
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

item.name: Maximum number of processes
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

item.name: Number of running processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: Number of processes
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: Processor load (1 min average)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load.

item.name: Processor load (5 min average)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load.

item.name: Processor load (15 min average)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: Host name
item.description: System host name.

item.name: System information
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: Cached memory
item.description: Cached memory for other ones

item.name: Used memory
item.description: active + wired

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces as defined in global regular expression "Network interfaces for discovery".

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types as defined in global regular expression "File systems for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space is less than {$FREE_DISK_SPACE}% on volume {#FSNAME}
Free inodes is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}

trigger.name: Configured max number of opened files is too low on {HOST.NAME}
Configured max number of processes is too low on {HOST.NAME}
Disk I/O is overloaded on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: OS spends significant time waiting for I/O (input/output) operations. It could be indicator of performance issues with storage system.

trigger.name: Lack of available memory on server {HOST.NAME}
Lack of free swap space on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: It probably means that the systems requires more physical memory.

trigger.name: Nginx: nginx is not running on {HOST.NAME}
Processor load is too high on {HOST.NAME}
